page.title: 18Life in Little Berkhamsted.3
page.content: In the last question of our questionnaire the villagers were asked why they preferred the{LIFESTYLE}of a village to a town. Many did not like the bustle and traffic of a town, although some said that there could be less traffic, and improved bus service and more street lighting, in the village. The majority gave reasons that they enjoyed rural and village life, it was convenient for towns (provided they had a car) and many had friends in the village. Some villagers had been born in the area and lived there all their lives (one since 1925). One liked the horses and the peace of the country. Many said that they did not live in a town because they disliked noise, traffic, bustle and one because he would not be able to settle.
